title: Apply custom background image and improve text visibility

requirements.summary: Apply uploaded image IMG_20260219_080023.png.jpg as fixed background across all pages
acceptanceCriteria: The uploaded image is displayed as a fixed background across all application pages
Background image maintains proper aspect ratio and covers the entire viewport
Background image does not interfere with content readability

file_operations.description: Add global CSS rule to apply the uploaded image IMG_20260219_080023.png.jpg as a fixed background using the asset path frontend/public/assets/IMG_20260219_080023.png.jpg. Configure background-size: cover, background-position: center, background-attachment: fixed, and background-repeat: no-repeat on the body element to ensure the image covers the viewport and maintains proper aspect ratio without interfering with content readability.

requirements.summary: Ensure dark theme is maintained with semi-transparent overlays for UI components
acceptanceCriteria: All UI components maintain dark theme styling
Cards, panels, and overlays have dark backgrounds that contrast with the background image
Navigation elements preserve dark theme appearance

file_operations.description: Add dark semi-transparent overlay styles for cards, panels, and containers using rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.75) to rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.85) backgrounds with backdrop-filter: blur(8px) for glassmorphism effect. Apply these styles to common container classes to ensure UI components contrast properly with the background image while preserving the dark sci-fi aesthetic.

Update the AppLayout component to add semi-transparent dark backgrounds (rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8)) to the header, sidebar, and footer elements. Ensure navigation elements maintain visibility and contrast against the new background image while preserving the existing dark theme styling and layout structure.

Update card and panel backgrounds in DashboardPage to use semi-transparent dark overlays (rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.75) with backdrop-filter) to ensure stat cards, progress bars, and content sections maintain readability and contrast against the background image.
Update mission card backgrounds to use semi-transparent dark overlays ensuring mission information, requirements, and rewards remain clearly readable against the background image.
Update stat allocation UI containers and cards to use semi-transparent dark overlays ensuring stat information and controls maintain visibility against the background image.
Update skill card backgrounds to use semi-transparent dark overlays ensuring skill information, requirements, and unlock status remain clearly readable against the background image.
Update profile information containers to use semi-transparent dark overlays ensuring user profile data maintains readability against the background image.
Update hero section and feature cards to use semi-transparent dark overlays ensuring marketing content and login button remain clearly visible against the background image.

requirements.summary: Update font colors to white or near-white tones for visibility against dark background
acceptanceCriteria: Primary text uses white or near-white colors (e.g., rgb(255, 255, 255) or rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.9))
All text elements are clearly readable against the background image
Text contrast meets accessibility standards for dark backgrounds
Secondary text uses lighter shades (e.g., rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.7)) while maintaining readability

file_operations.description: Update the Tailwind color theme to ensure primary text colors use white or near-white values (rgb(255, 255, 255) or rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.9)) and secondary text uses rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.7). Modify the foreground color definitions in the dark theme section to ensure all text elements meet accessibility contrast standards for dark backgrounds.

Add global text color overrides using CSS custom properties to set --text-primary to rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.95), --text-secondary to rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.75), and --text-muted to rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.6). Apply these variables to body text, headings, and common text classes to ensure consistent white/near-white text visibility across the application.

Update text color classes in navigation links, header text, and footer text to use white or near-white colors (text-white or text-white/95) ensuring all navigation elements are clearly readable against the dark background.
Update text colors in the profile setup dialog to use white or near-white tones ensuring the nickname input label, helper text, and dialog content are clearly visible.
Ensure login button text uses appropriate white or near-white colors when displayed on dark backgrounds for visibility against the background image.
